lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Reagan's 1988 budget proposed 22 billion in revenue increases from sales of federal assets such as the Amtrak railroad, higher federal fees for services and larger individual payments for social programs.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The tax would be a tax on capital which would discourage all but the most profitable short-term transactions and could lead to creation of a duty-free market abroad.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Office of Management and Budget director James Miller said President Reagan opposes increases in the federal excise taxes on gas, cigarettes or alcohol to help reduce the federal budget deficit.
